Calling newInstance on the ComponentFactory service provided by org.eclipse.equinox.ds_1.0.0 bundle, under high concurrent load causes java.util.ConcurrentModificationException.

To reproduce, simply run many threads in an OSGi SCR, each of which tries to create new component instances. The stack trace observed looks like the following:

java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
        at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.checkForComodification(AbstractList.java:4
49)
        at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.next(AbstractList.java:420)
        at org.eclipse.equinox.ds.resolver.Resolver.resolveSatisfied(Resolver.ja
va:588)
        at org.eclipse.equinox.ds.resolver.Resolver.justResolve(Resolver.java:55
4)
        at org.eclipse.equinox.ds.service.ComponentFactoryImpl.newInstance(Compo
nentFactoryImpl.java:74) 
...
Bug #181858 includes a fix for this bug.

The ProSyst DS impl does not have any open timing or deadlock issues against it. I would say that it is thread safe. Since the ProSyst's contributed DS is the Equinox DS implementation now, I change the resolution of the bug to worksforme.
